resources.string: 12-yr-old Indian-American boy wins National Spelling Bee contest in US

A 12-year-old Indian-American seventh-grader from Florida, Bruhat Soma, won the Scripps National Spelling Bee after he spelt 29 words correctly in 90 seconds in a tiebreaker. Launched in 1925, the Scripps National Spelling Bee is the US\' largest and longest-running educational programme. He had got the 163rd place in the competition in 2022 and 74th in 2023
